system.description:
• Merrek and Myra are known by the other Derelicts as “Rough and Tumble,” for when they are in close combat together they toss one another around, increasing their offensive and defensive output.

    • When side by side, they have advantage on dodges and defensive maneuvers.

    • When side by side, they have advantage on attacks.
• Merrek and Myra, when side by side outside of combat, have advantage on all rolls.

• When apart, Merrek and Myra's spiritual link allows them to see through one another’s eyes and communicate with one another over long distances (up to 350 feet) for 1 minute.

    • This allows them to use 2 Brains, Better than 1 even when separated.

    • This can be used a number of times equal to their proficiency bonus and cannot be used again until a long rest.

Includes:

  • 1x Backpack

  • 1x Bedroll

  • 1x Mess Tin

  • 1x Tinderbox

  • 10x Torch

  • 10x Rations (1 Supply)

  • 1x Waterskin

  • 1x Rope, Hempen (50 Feet)
Armor Class 12 + Dexterity Modifier

• At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

    • You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

      • Range

        • You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons. (Already Applied)

• You are particularly familiar with Forests and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

    • When you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to your favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled if you are using a skill that you’re proficient in.

    • While traveling in this favored terrain, you gain the following benefits:

      • Nonmagical difficult terrain doesn’t slow your group’s travel outside of combat.

      • You ignore nonmagical difficult terrain in and out of combat.

      • Your group can’t become lost except by magical means.

      • Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.

      • If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.

      • When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.

      • While tracking other creatures, you learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

      • You choose additional favored terrain types at 6th and 10th level.

      • You have advantage on initiative rolls.

      • In combat, you have advantage when rolling toward creatures who haven't yet acted.

        • This applies when rolling toward your party members and your enemies.

• You are particularly familiar with Mountains and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

    • When you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to this favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled if you are using a skill that you’re proficient in.

    • While traveling in this favored terrain, you gain the following benefits:

      • Nonmagical difficult terrain doesn’t slow your group’s travel outside of combat.

      • You ignore nonmagical difficult terrain in and out of combat.

      • Your group can’t become lost except by magical means.

      • Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.

      • If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.

      • When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.

      • While tracking other creatures, you learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

      • You choose additional favored terrain types at 6th and 10th level.

      • You have advantage on initiative rolls.

      • In combat, you have advantage when rolling toward creatures who haven't yet acted.

        • This applies when rolling toward your party members and your enemies.

• You have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to undead creatures.

    • You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track this Favored Enemy, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

    • When you gain this feature, you also become an expert in the languages of your choice that are spoken by this Favored Enemy, if they speak one at all.

      • In this case the Necromancer’s undead language: Necron

    • When rolling damage against this Favored Enemy you may add +2 unavoidable damage to the roll.

• Starting at 2nd level, you have a maximum number of Summoned Arrows you can summon equal to your Ranger level.

    • Firing a Summoned Arrow counts as an attack, even if they are being fired at your allies to bolster them.

    • Myra cannot fire these arrows into herself.

    • You recover a number of Summoned Arrows equal to half your maximum number of arrows, not to exceed your max, after a short rest.

      • For example, if you have a max of 12 and you’ve used 5, you gain 6 during a short rest bringing you to 11.

        • Alternatively, If you were at 10, you only gain 2, bringing you to the max of 12.

    • You recover all Summoned Arrows after a short rest.

• By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does.

    • Spell Slots

      • For example, if you know the 1st-level spell Animal Friendship and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast Animal Friendship using either slot.

      • Go here for a full list of spells at each level:

        • http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/spells:ranger

      • I suggest you check out this page for the best ranger spells and suggestions on how to best use them:

        • https://www.flutesloot.com/best-ranger-spells/

    • The Ranger table shows how many Spell Slots you have to cast your Ranger spells of 1st level and higher.

    • You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

    • To cast one of these spells, you must expend a Spell Slot of the spell’s level or higher. 

    • When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Ranger spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Ranger Spell List, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

  • Spellcasting Ability

    • Wisdom is your Spellcasting Ability for your Ranger spells, since your magic draws on your attunement to nature.

      • You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your Spellcasting Ability.

      • In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Ranger spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

  • Spell Save DC

    • 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

  • Spell Attack Modifier

    • Your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

c7P1VvSLTjWZ2Gxn.name: Gain Advantage
c7P1VvSLTjWZ2Gxn.description: • You gain advantage on your attack rolls against the creature.

uJqYub9ZZulINwA4.name: Spinal Tap (Grapple)
uJqYub9ZZulINwA4.description: • You may choose to roll without advantage in an attempt to strike the creature's spine and cause them to become Grappled.

6GzUaMAjPhlCaQNd.name: Head Shot (Stun)
6GzUaMAjPhlCaQNd.description: • You may choose to roll without advantage in an attempt to strike the creature's head, stunning them.

IPqFhlJ1EJYgL69L.name: Downfall of Achilles (Prone)
IPqFhlJ1EJYgL69L.description: • You may choose to roll without advantage in an attempt to strike the creature's knee, ankle, or achilles, causing them to fall prone.

WrvsymriHRsvOOME.name: Between the Scales (Bleed)
WrvsymriHRsvOOME.description: • You may choose to roll without advantage in an attempt to strike in such a way that causes the creature sto bleed profusely.

system.description:
• Beginning at 2nd level, after fighting with an individual for 3 rounds, you hone in on their weak spots, loosing your arrows to fit between the chinks of their armor.

    • This happens immediately after the first round if the creature is a Favored Enemy.

    • Choose one of the following:

      • You gain advantage on your attack rolls against the creature.

      • You may choose to roll without advantage in an attempt to cause Grappled (Spine), Prone (Knee/Ankle), Stunned (Head), Bleeding (Anywhere Else).

• During their initiative, Myra can speak directly into Fenrir's mind through their Spiritual Bond to give Fenrir commands.

  • Fenrir takes his turn during Myra’s initiative, before or after she takes her turn.

    • You choose each turn who goes first in order to set up combinations between the two of you.

  • You can also speak in this way to suggest it to Attack, Dash, Disengage, or Help Another.

    • Fenrir never requires your command to use its reaction, such as when making an opportunity attack.

    • Once you have the Extra Attack feature, you can make one weapon attack yourself while commanding Fenrir to take your Attack action.

    • If you don’t issue a request, Fenrir takes the Dodge action.

    • If you are incapacitated or absent, the beast acts on its own, focusing on protecting you and itself.

  • While traveling through your Favored Terrain with Fenrir, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.

  • If Fenrir dies, you may obtain another Spiritual Bond with a creature by spending 8 hours in the forest tracking down and magically bonding to it as long as it isn’t hostile to you.

    • This will either be the same type of beast as before or a different one.

• Beginning at 3rd level, you can use your action and expend one Ranger Spell Slot to focus your awareness on the region around you, honing in on your Favored Enemies.

    • For 1 minute per level of the spell slot you expend, you can sense what Favored Enemies are present within 1 mile of you

      • This is increased to 6 miles in your Favored Terrains.

      • This doesn’t reveal where they are exactly, but will give you a general direction to hunt in.
• Advantage on poison saves and poison resistance.
• Your expertise aids you in identifying a stone, metal, or earthen structures date of construction and purpose, and insight into who might have built it.

• Although Myra has the ability to interrupt shifting and can shift on command, if the Moon shifts she may roll 1d20.

    • 1-4: You transform into your Wereowl Form

    • 5-12: You transform into your Hybrid Form.

    • 13-20: You remain as you are or you may choose to transform into your Hybrid Form as a Free Action.

• Lycanthropes are vulnerable to Silvered Weapons.

    • If a Silvered weapon/projectile remains in you at the beginning of your turn, you take 1d6 damage that cannot be reduced in any way.

RWJFgs4SA3HKdn2K.name: Mold Earth Cantrip
RWJFgs4SA3HKdn2K.description:
You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

  • If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage.

  • You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the dirt or stone, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

  • If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

system.description:
• You never leave home without your trusty pickaxes.

  • You are immediately attuned to these magical pickaxes.

  • The pick is both a set of mason's tools and a martial melee weapon which you are proficient in.

  • It deals 1d8 piercing damage on a hit, or 1d10 piercing damage if held in two hands.

    • Add your Dexterity Modifier to the damage.

  • While holding the pick, you gain the following benefits:

    • When using this speed you leave minor disturbances on the surface above.

    • You gain a burrow speed equal to half your movement speed.

    • You can cast the Mold Earth Cantrip, following the two uses active rule.

  • At the end of a long rest, you can create a new Multipurpose Pickaxe by touching a miner's pick or a War Pick.

    • If you already have a multipurpose pick from this feature, the first one immediately becomes a normal pick.

    • The pickaxes only respond to their owners and may not be magically used by any other creature.

9z0VPOuak43HUzIl.name: Bury
9z0VPOuak43HUzIl.description: • You may attack a grounded creature by gripping the Multipurpose Pickaxe in two hands and swing downward at their feet dealing 1d6 + Strength Modifier in Piercing Damage on a hit and forcing them to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Strength DC or have it be restrained, as you partially bury its body beneath the ground.

nDPHEoDA7ipaJ5Sf.name: Pull Free
nDPHEoDA7ipaJ5Sf.description: • The buried creature, or another individual within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a Strength save against Merrek's Strength DC to try and pull out the stuck creature.

system.description:
• You may attack a grounded creature by gripping the Multipurpose Pickaxe in two hands and swing downward at their feet dealing 1d6 + Strength Modifier in Piercing Damage on a hit and forcing them to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Strength DC or have it be restrained, as you partially bury its body beneath the ground.

      • The creature, or another individual within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your Strength DC to try and pull out the stuck creature.

fLAwCIOUGkt6r38b.onSave: They take half damage and are only pulled 10 feet

system.description:
(cleric, druid, ranger, sorcerer, warlock, wizard)

  • You fire a projectile of condensed gravitational force toward a creature you can see within range.
    • Make a ranged spell attack against the target.
    • On a hit, the target takes 2d8 force damage and is pulled 20 feet in a
      straight line toward you.
      • If they're successful with their dexterity save they take half the damage and are only pulled 10 feet

Cast at Higher Levels:

  • When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

 

Source: Steinhardt's Guild Spells

(bard, druid, ranger, warlock)

  • You blow on a whistle, releasing an inaudible sound.
    • Choose a point on the ground within range.
      • The first time a creature moves while within a 10-foot square centered on that point before the spell ends, an eldritch maw immediately erupts from beneath the ground, dealing 2d10 piercing damage to each creature
        within the square and knocking them prone, ending the spell.
        • On a Dex Save they take half damage and are not knocked prone.


Cast at Higher Levels:

  • When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd.
  • If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell can trigger a second time before it ends.

 

Source: Steinhardt's Guild Spells

PDhurhLYQgYZzX65.name: Zephyr Strike Movement
PDhurhLYQgYZzX65.description:
• You move like the wind.
    • Until the spell ends, your movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.
    • Your walking speed increases by 30 feet until the end of that turn.

8wvyeWgJtuLNW2IG.name: Zephyr Strike Damage Bonus
8wvyeWgJtuLNW2IG.description:
• Advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn.
    • That attack deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit.

system.description:
(Ranger)

  • You move like the wind.
    • Until the spell ends, your movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.
    • Your walking speed increases by 30 feet until the end of that turn.
    • Once before the spell ends, you can give yourself the following:
      • Advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn.
        • That attack deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit.

 

Source: Xanathar's Guide To Everything

effects.name: Zephyr Strike Movement Increase
effects.description:
• You move like the wind.
    • Until the spell ends, your movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.
    • Your walking speed increases by 30 feet until the end of that turn.
    • Once before the spell ends, you can give yourself the following:
      • Advantage on one weapon attack roll on your turn.
        • That attack deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit.

system.description:
(Druid or Ranger)

  • You transform the components into 2d4 berries.
    • For the next 24 hours, any creature that consumes one of these berries regains 1 hit point.
      • Eating or administering a berry is an action.
      • The berries do not provide any nourishment or sate hunger.

Cast at Higher Levels. You create 1d4 additional berries for every 2 slot levels above 1st.
system.materials: mistletoe and a handful of grass

system.description:
• A creature can use its action to eat one berry.
    • Eating a berry restores 1 hit point, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
    • The berries lose their potency if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.

8MrZdPi03me7yE7Q.name: Energizing Arrow
8MrZdPi03me7yE7Q.description:
• Merrek +2 Ki

  • Nep Nik +2 Charges

  • Teresa +2 Sorcery Points

  • Mogli +1 Spell Slots
  • Hákarl +5 Agony Pool
  • ??? +5 ???

system.description:
• At 2nd level, you may summon an Energizing Arrow from your Wedding Band of Order and shoot it at an ally to give them back some of their primary energy source used for abilities, spells, etc…

    • Merrek +2 Ki

    • Nep Nik +2 Charges

    • Teresa +2 Sorcery Points

    • Mogli +1 Spell Slots
    • Hákarl +5 Agony Pool
    • ??? +5 Blood Pool
    • Fenrir +1d10 HP

These tools allow you to turn a specific type of raw material into generic trade goods using your time, effort, and skill. The type of tool determines the materials and amount of time needed. After spending the needed time and materials, you make a profession check with those tools which determines the value of the resulting generic trade goods (on a result of 15 or lower the materials used are wasted).

Material: 1 sp of stone

Time: 1 week (8 hours per day)

DC Value
15 10 gp
20 30 gp
25+ 50 gp

• A set of wedding bands was given to Merrek and Myra as a marriage gift, giving them the ability to call forth their summonable items, including clothing.

  • Used to call forth Summoned Arrows into your bow during your Dwarvenguard/Hybrid form.

  • Used to call forth your Collision Crystal Sniper Rifle in your Dwarvenguard/Hybrid form.

5H8rRyBOv3di6Gud.name: Piercing Beam

Gdddon8JStKIhz9i.label: Piercing Beam Dexterity Save
Gdddon8JStKIhz9i.onSave: Half Damage and Avoid Crippling Shot (Passive)

5H8rRyBOv3di6Gud.description:
• Piercing Beam

    • There is no distance this focused Collision Crystal beam cannot reach and it can pass through one wall or creature before ceasing.

      • The first and second creature within its path take 2d10 piercing damage.

        • This damage increases to 3d10 at level 11

        • This damage increases to 4d10 at level 17.

      • If this passes through a creature or wall before hitting its second target, it does 1d10 force damage instead.

        • This damage increases to 2d10 at level 11

        • This damage increases to 3d10 at level 17.

      • The targets may roll a Dexterity save to take half damage and avoid Crippling Shot's effects.

EaA9xxHW5y1pj4mw.name: Dead Eye Headshot - basic

D8NWNoRBQOF7URVT.label: Dead Eye Headshot Saving Throw
D8NWNoRBQOF7URVT.onSave: Half Damage and Avoid Crippling Shot (Passive)

EaA9xxHW5y1pj4mw.description:
• This uses Fenrir’s action as well to focus on an enemy of your choosing.

    • Using what you see through Fenrir and Merrek, you focus all of your energy on pinpointing and firing upon the chosen enemy’s weak spot and you fire with advantage on the creature, expending two uses of your Collision Crystal Sniper Rifle and are granted an automatic critical hit.

        • They must succeed on a Dexterity Saving Throw of 15 or take 4d10 Piercing damage.

            • They roll with Disadvantage and take half damage if they succeed.

            • They take 6d10 Piercing damage if they are a Favored Enemy.

    • Piercing Beam rules of second target still apply with its original damage since its weaknesses weren’t taken into account.

mXJXzpBk5D36x09s.name: Dead Eye Headshot - Favored Enemy

D8NWNoRBQOF7URVT.label: Dead Eye Headshot Saving Throw
D8NWNoRBQOF7URVT.onSave: Half Damage and Avoid Crippling Shot (Passive)

mXJXzpBk5D36x09s.description:
• Favored Enemy Rules

  • This uses Fenrir’s action as well to focus on an enemy of your choosing.

  • Using what you see through Fenrir and Merrek, you focus all of your energy on pinpointing and firing upon the chosen enemy’s weak spot and you fire with advantage on the creature, expending two uses of your Collision Crystal Sniper Rifle and are granted an automatic critical hit.

      • They must succeed on a Dexterity Saving Throw of 18 or take 6d10 Piercing damage.

          • They roll with Disadvantage and take half damage if they succeed.

  • Piercing Beam rules of second target still apply with its original damage since its weaknesses weren’t taken into account.

system.description:
• You can use the Collision Crystal Sniper Rifle a number of times equal to the Wisdom Modifier of Myra’s Dwarvenguard Form, and regain all expended uses after completing a long rest.

  • It takes your entire turn to focus and fire this weapon, including your personal free actions and bonus actions.

    • Fenrir’s actions and bonuses however are not disabled, unless you use Dead Eye Headshot.

Crippling Shot (Passive)

  • Once per turn, when you damage an enemy with an attack made using your Collision Crystal Sniper Rifle, they fall prone and have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn if they fail their Dexterity save.
Heavy, Range (150/600), Two-Handed
A bundle of 20 arrows.
• If you have a non-incapacitated ally within 5-feet of a creature, you have advantage on attack rolls.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You may use your Disarm maneuver to attempt to knock an item or weapon from a creature's hand.
    • The target must be within your reach and be holding an item (either carried or wielded).
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • The target has advantage if it is larger than you or holding the item with two or more hands
        • Alternatively, a target smaller than you has disadvantage.
          • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target drops the item in its space.

• While you cannot grapple a creature two or more size categories larger than you, you can grab onto it.
    • By jumping onto its back or climbing up a limb, you can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against the creature's maneuver DC to cling to or balance upon its body.
      • On a success, you move into the creature's space and can move upon its body as if it is difficult terrain.
  • While grabbing onto a larger creature, you gain advantage on attack rolls against it.
    • The larger creature may be able to attack you as normal, depending on its limbs or attacks.
      • It can also use an action or replace one of its attacks on its turn to try to dislodge you, such as shaking you loose or bashing you against a wall, forcing you to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against its maneuver DC or fall prone into the nearest space adjacent to the creature, taking its basic melee damage in the process.
  • If the creature chooses to roll over in order to dislodge you, it becomes prone, but you have disadvantage on the saving throw to hang on.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Grapple maneuver to grab or wrestle a creature
    • You must have at least one free hand to attempt a grapple, your target must be within your reach, and the target must be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target becomes grappled.
          • In addition to things that end the condition, you can release the target at any time (no action required).
  • Escaping a Grapple
    • While grappled, a creature can use its action to attempt to escape. It must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
  • Moving a Grappled Creature
    • When you move, you can drag or carry the grappled creature with you.
      • When you do so, your Speed is halved, unless the creature's weight is within your carrying capacity and you are not encumbered by bulky items.
  • Freeing a Grappled Creature
    • You can use the Grapple maneuver to try to free another grappled or restrained creature.
      • The creature grappling or restraining the target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • If it fails the saving throw, the grappled or restrained creature is freed.
        • Additionally, you may move the freed creature 5 feet in any direction.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Knockdown maneuver to trip or push a creature down.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
    • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
      • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and knock the target prone.

• You can use an action or bonus action to make an Overrun maneuver to move through a hostile creature's space by forcing your way past.
    • Make a Strength saving throw against the target's maneuver DC.
      • On a success, you deal basic melee damage and can move through the hostile creature's space once this turn.
      • The creature can choose to let you pass instead of rolling.
      • You have advantage if you are larger than the target, or disadvantage if you are smaller.
      • If you are two or more sizes smaller than the target, you can move through the hostile creature's space without making a save.
      • You still provoke opportunity attacks if you move beyond a creature's reach.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Shove maneuver to push a creature away.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and push the target a number of feet away from you equal to 5 + 5 for every 5 points it failed its saving throw by.
          • You can move the creature in any direction away from you (to the side, forward, or diagonally away).
    • A creature that is shoved off of a precipice is propelled off of whatever it is standing on -- it does not receive any saving throw or ability check to grab onto something to avoid falling down below.

• Allows a character to evade opportunity attacks for the rest of their turn.
    • It’s a defensive tactic used when you want to safely move away from an enemy without risking a free swing.

• Lycanthropes are repelled by the Wolfsbane flower.

    • A lycanthrope in hybrid or beast form is poisoned while within 10 feet of a living or dried Wolfsbane flower that it can smell.

    • If Wolfsbane is applied to a weapon or ammunition, lycanthropes are damaged by the weapon as if it were Silvered.

    • A successful application of Wolfsbane lasts for 1 hour.

    • If Wolfsbane remains ingested or a Wolfsbane laced weapon/projectile remains inside you at the start of your turn, you take 1d6 damage that cannot be reduced in any way.
  • GM Notes: Remember to roll twice as you have advantage on all poison saves as a Mountain Dwarvenguard

• Taking the Dash action gives you additional movement, equal to your speed, for the current turn.
    • For a creature with a walking speed of 30ft, this means their movement for that turn would increase to 60ft.
      • This bonus includes any modifiers to your speed
      • This also applies to negative modifiers
      • Note: A situation that often causes confusion is when you Dash after standing up from being prone, which costs half of your movement.
        • Creatures with 30ft speed who are standing up from being knocked prone only has 15ft of movement remaining, but Dash doubles the original 30ft, and therefore they can move 45ft after getting up from being knocked prone.

• When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks.
    • Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker.
    • Addtionally, you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage.
    • Note: You lose these benefits if you are incapacitated or if your speed drops to 0.

One of the many secrets unveiled about Sevani Dreigh Ude by Mogli is the discovery of how to create Portal Coins for his Elite Warriors. By sacrificing his own life force, one full year to be exact, he can fuse a coin to the blood of one of his Elite. Only the person fused to the coin can use the Portal Coin to return to Sevani Dreigh Ude. These coins can also be used by his Elite to return to Mogli's side, but this can only occur once per day as he does not carry the same amount of power to move creatures across the cosmos as Sevani Dreigh Ude encompasses.

 

Merrek and Myra share a Portal Coin. When used by whoever holds it, they are both tranported, no matter how far apart they may be.

iTCXV3iJO1HG6QnT.name: Featherfall on Self
iTCXV3iJO1HG6QnT.description:
• The falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends.
  • If the creature should take falling damage before the hour is up, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

system.description:
• Once invoked, you gain the effects of the Feather Fall spell for 1 hour.
  • This rune has 1 charge per day and regains its charge at dawn

effects.name: Feather Fall
effects.description: You take no falling damage for one hour.
